name: Gloom 8bit Killer
overview: 8bit Killer is an indie game first-person 3D shooter that was initially released for Microsoft Windows in 2008 it was later ported to Amiga in 2014. It plays like early raycasting games such as Catabomb 3D or Wolfenstein 3D, featuring music and aesthetics one may find in an 8bit game for the Nintendo Entertainment System. This is an Amiga port of sorts in the Gloom engine. Textures and some sounds were reused. However, the story screens and the music were removed. Due to engine limitations, none of the original levels were recreated.
